snippet: Two Australians are among eight convicted drug smugglers who will be transferred this week to the prison island of Nusa Kambangan for imminent execution, an official said Monday.
abstract: Indonesian Pres Joko Widodo rejects several clemency appeals by Australian government on behalf of 2 men convicted of drug smuggling and facing execution; Australians Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran, leaders of Bali Nine group, are sentenced to be executed for 2005 attempt to smuggle 18 pounds of heroin into Australia.
lead_paragraph: Two Australians are among eight convicted drug smugglers who will be transferred this week to the prison island of Nusa Kambangan for imminent execution, an official said Monday.

headline.main: Indonesia: Executions Imminent for Foreigners Convicted of Smuggling
headline.print_headline: Indonesia: Executions Imminent for Foreigners Convicted of Smuggling
